poem:
### For the Discerning Child

In gardens of distant lands,  
where zero-proof potions play—  
young feet dance to foreign drums,  
curious for flavors  
and sky-high dreams. They craft  
with small hands an age  
of wonder and awe, knowing  
each step, each taste  
is a new world  
only they can find.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From zero-proof mixology to Balinese dance lessons: welcome to the new era of kids’ clubs on holiday About 70% of travellers pick their destination based on their kids’ needs and interests, according to global research from Hilton. And generation Alpha, aged 14 and under, are particularly discerning; with their sophisticated palates, expectations are sky-high. Across Southeast Asia, Hilton has been crafting unique experiences for its young guests. These expertly curated kids’ clubs allow children to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
